Challah

By Zinzy Waleson Geene, last updated on November 26, 2022

A recipe for challah

Since the beginning of my relationship with Anja I‚Äôve been periodically baking challahs for shabbos. This page details the recipe I use, and how I‚Äôve been refining it through the years.

April 2022

I‚Äôve been experimenting with dough variation, choosing a more pastry-style dough instead of something that‚Äôs traditionally bready.

Baking bread, to me, can instantly turn into failure if what I taste three hours later isn‚Äôt as fluffy and fresh as it was when it came out of the oven. Julia Turshen‚Äôs recipe for jam buns turns out to be perfect for challah. I still use the braiding technique from Gefilteria, and substitute half of Julia‚Äôs butter for olive oil to add some extra fluff. It‚Äôs heaven.

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She's interested in humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking. She engages in mellow cultural and critical analysis, linking and tinkering on her personal website, zinzy.website .
